title: No puedo enviar correos con Thunderbird
creator: dpi2
content: Hola a todos. Desde hace unos días, no puedo enviar mensajes (si los recibo), me sale un cartel diciendo "Falló el envío del mensaje. El mensaje no se ha podido enviar porque ha caducado la conexión al servidor de salida (SMTP) smtp.xxx-xxxxxxxxx.com. Vuelva a intentarlo." He revisado todos los datos del servidor de salida y son los mismos que tenía antes. he cambiado a varios puertos diferentes y nada. También he reinstalado a la última versión y sigue sin funcionar. No se si es problema de thunderbird o de windows, pero lo raro es que nos pasa a los 5 compañeros que tenemos esta dirección de correo común. Alguien sabe que puedo hacer? Muchas gracias de antemano.

title: Non funzionano più gli account gmail.com
creator: biagio.prisco
content:
Salve, uso da tempo Thunderbird con 7 account diversi. Da un pò non riconosce più gli account gmail.com Tutti gli altri funzionano correttamente. Ho fatto tutte le prove possibili (cancellato cert9, key4, logins, prefs ecc...,) , mi sono avvalso anche di Chat-Gpt pro ma niente. Ho cancellato Thunderbird (dopo aver salvato le cartella Mail e Imap), rimosso tutte le tracce sul disco e dal registro di configurazione e reinstallato l'ultima versione. Nulla... Praticamanete quando cerco di configurare un indirizzo gmail.com si apre la finestra degli account, mi fa scegliere l'account, successivamente si apre la finestra google: L'app Mozilla Thunderbird Email richiede l'accesso all'Account Google, clicco su Consenti e va in errore

Errore di autenticazione. Impossibile autenticarsi sul server. La configurazione, il nome utente o la password potrebbero essere errati.

Ovviamente utente e password sono corretti. Con qualsiasi altro client di posta funziona tutto perfettamente. Cosa altro posso fare? Mi dispiacerebbe passare ad altro client.... Grazie anticipatamente se potete darmi qualche aiuto

title: Problem with one gmail account in Thunderbird
creator: emp3trzy
content: Hello, a few days ago, I started having problems with one of my Gmail accounts. I use Thunderbird and have several different Gmail addresses assigned to it. A few days ago, one of the mailboxes stopped working properly, i.e., messages download very slowly, it's impossible to mark a message as read (and if it happens after a few minutes, the message is still unread on the mail.google.com/mail page). I suspect a synchronization problem with Thunderbird, because everything arrives instantly directly on the Gmail page. I've been using this mailbox for over two years and never had any problems. The mailbox was used normally, i.e., dozens of incoming messages a day and a few outgoing messages, without large attachments. The settings weren't changed either -> imap.gmail.com / 993 ; SSL/TLS OAuth2 ; smtp.gmail.com / 465 ; SSL/TLS OAuth2. I tried adding the mailbox again, but the same thing is happening today. I tried different settings in Thunderbird and in Google settings, but nothing helped. Does anyone have any ideas why this is happening? I have to use the web version of Gmail, because nothing can be done on Thunderbird. to do it efficiently - read or reply to a message.

title: Detach attachment error
creator: kamleshbarot
content:
Dear Thunderbird,

I have been using Eudora for 20 plus years and migrated to Thunderbird after Mozilla took it over. After my donation, I have observed that the last update that you have done, has a bug.

I would always detach any attachments on my email and categorize them in my set directories for easy retrieval and I have these files since 1991. Off late when I detach a file it deletes it from the email, and saves it to my attach folder, desingated in the options menu, making my inbox file that I backup smaller and managable on a pen drive too. Now when I detach files, it deletes them from the email but the attach directory is always empty.

Please rectify this as it is causing a lot of files being lost.

-- with warm regards

Kamlesh Barot

Director - VIE Hospitality
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/140.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Why is outgoing mail from diverse email accounts and destinations being rejected?
creator: simbats4z
content:
Hi there I have a problem that has become more serious of late. I am asking because I mostly use Thunderbird, but it is not limited to it. Please patiently read to understand the problem ...

I regularly use 4 Wifi networks, 3 of them, I will name A, B & C connected to 3 different local universities and one the home network. There is no problem sending mail in 100% of cases, at home & networks A & B. I noted though at network C, where I am mostly on Sunday's, when I send mail, basically with Thunderbird from one of my Gmail accounts to a particular friend's Yahoo email, that the email bounced with some errors I did not bother to read. Since it'd happen repeatedly for months, I just sent them later from any of the other 3 networks. I thought may be it has something to do with that particular university's network security settings. The emails are just text messages, now & then with photos.

Then last Saturday, after emails while in network C were repeatedly rejected, I remembered, whenever I log in to my webhost's website to work on my site, that it does not connect with some error. Also a Filezilla FTP client does not work, but in both cases, when I use a VPN client, both work. I tried VPN, and sent an email to this friend & it was also rejected. Same when I tried using a browser. Sending emails to other people, I have never noticed any problem,, just this particular Yahoo email. I need to say during the several trials, 1 managed to slip through, though I had forgotten to paste some text & so tried sending again. Same issues, when I used a different Gmail address.

That evening, I also tried send the message from the home network & to my horror, it was rejected. That had never happened before outside university network C.

The following day, I decided, while using Network C to try sending that same message from an Outlook email address to that Yahoo email & CCed emails of mine, Gmail & AOL & Yahoo. None arrived. As said, the problem seems to involve this Yahoo email of a friend, because all other emails go with no issue. Up to last weekend the issue was only when I was at network C, but now at home + university network A. Not been at B of late.

This is part of the error message:

Message blocked: Your message to friendsmail@yahoo.com has been blocked. See technical details below for more information.

The response from the remote server was: 554 Message not allowed - [PH01] Email not accepted for policy reasons. Please visit https://senders.yahooinc.com/error-codes I read somewhere 554 error messages are permanently blocked or something like that.

The question is what is causing this and how can it be solved? I tried giving a detailed explanation in the NEW Microsoft forum website "learn.microsoft ...", but I discovered later the post was deleted for supposedly violating community guidelines. I posted on the former "answers.microsoft. ..." for over 10 years and there was never an issue, so that was annoying, especially not knowing what in my explanation broke their rules. Also search results for possible answers mostly involved issues with the MS Mail client, which is NOT my problem as you can see.

Since I mostly use Thunderbird, I though someone could help me find the cause and solution. I need to add, that friend with the Yahoo email address, has no similar issues and only hears about blocked messages from ME, previous, ONLY when sent from Network C. It is not that his email is blacklisted by Yahoo or he'd be getting no traffic at all from all other sources. I get dozens of emails a week and have NO known issues, of any blacklisted by anyone.

Before posting this, I decided to copy the exact message I sent to the friend, with an attached photo to these accounts of mine from a Gmail account on Thunderbird: Yahoo, a different Gmail, Outlook & AOL. Yahoo & AOL rejected the message, with identical error message:

Mail Delivery Subsystem <mailer-daemon@googlemail.com> 12:11

    • Message blocked ** Your message to myemail@aol.com has been blocked. See technical details below for more information. Learn more here: https://senders.yahooinc.com/error-codes (Warning: This link will take you to a third-party site) The response from the remote server was: 554 Message not …

Thank you in advance
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:142.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/142.0

title: Where does Firefox / Thunderbird source their spellcheckers?
creator: firefox3151
content:
TLDR: an upstream fix in hunspell/de_DE_frami.aff from libreoffice did not make it into mozilla in three years. Why?

The original problem: When typing in German on a non-German keyboard, one types "oe" instead of "ö" and "Ae" instead of "Ä" or "ss" instead of "ß". The German spellchecker with flag "fuer" as an error and correctly suggest "für" as a replacement.

The way the German spellcheckers are defined, they will identify a single use of such a replacement but not two adjacent ones. This had been extremely irritating to me when I try to end my emails with greetings "Grüße".

I type "Gruesse" and the spellchecker does not find "Grüße" as a correction.

The fix: Back in 2022 I finally decided to try and fix this bug myself. I discovered that in order to fix it, we needed to tweak a file called hunspell/de_DE.aff or hunspell/de_DE_frami.aff. I didn't know where to submit this correction, but ultimately found the source for these files to be in the libreoffice project. They accepted my merge request in 3 years ago in September 2022. https://github.com/LibreOffice/dictionaries/pull/40 https://gerrit.libreoffice.org/c/dictionaries/+/136067

Today's problem: I was assuming that over time that change would propagate to all downstream projects using these dictionaries, but this is not the case.

Today, in September 2025, using ubuntu-snap installed Thunderbird version 140.2.0esr-3, and Firefox version 142.0.1-1 I can see that neither of them include the fixed dictionary - neither in de_DE nor in de_DE_frami.

So here is my question: Where does thunderbird and where does firefox get their language definitions from? Where do I need to submit this fix to the hunspell dictionaries in order for it to finally make it to release?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:142.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/142.0

content:
With Firefox I manage 5 different e-mail adresses, and I notice today that only one adress has a specific "Sent" folder, actually it is the first adress which I have created with Firefox if I send an e-mail from another adress, it is stored in a common"Sent" folder located at mailbox://nobody@Local Folders/Sent

I want to have one "Sent" folder per e-mail adress

title: archiving multiple messages
creator: bos333
content:
In the past, I was able to select a large amount of emails, and then by clicking the archive button, all messages would be archived in their proper year. Now, this function does not work, and only archives a few at at time.

For example, I select several thousand messages and then click archive, and only 25 messages will archive. I must repeat the step over and over.

I use to be to do this on a much larger scale. Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks Byron

title: Outgoing email failure to send
creator: paris11
content: I recently migrated my files from a Windows 10 to Windows 11 computer. Since doing so, I am unable to send emails from one of the two email accounts I have. I can receive OK, but when I try to send I get an error message that says "Login to server mail.sonic.net with username paris2@sonic.net failed." Fro there it gets worse, asking for password input that it won't accept even though all my other devices (as well as the old computer) are fine with it. Sonic is not reading anything from their end, so they are unable to offer any help and anything Google provides as help in incorrect and doesn't work.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:142.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/142.0
